Package it.polimi.ingsw.controller

Class TurnController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.controller.TurnController
public class TurnController extends Object
Class TurnController is used to maintain the order of play during the turn. The order is calculated using the Strategy pattern between round phase (action phase and planning phase).
See Also:
  • PhaseOrder

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    private void
    calculateOrder()
    Calculate the order of play in the new RoundPhase using the correct PhaseOrder way of calculating it
    void
    changePhase()
    Switch the current RoundPhase: if the previous one was 'planning phase' the new one is 'action phase' and vice-versa
    boolean
    endTurn()
    Do all operations that need to be done at the end of a player turn (changing the active player and eventually change the current RoundPhase)
    Player
    getActivePlayer()
    Return the current active player of the RoundPhase
    RoundPhase
    getCurrentPhase()
    Return the current RoundPhase of the round
    PlanningPhaseOrder
    getPlanningPhaseOrderStrategy()
    Returns the object that is responsible for calculating the order in planning phase
    Player[]
    getPlayerOrder()
    Returns the current RoundPhase order of play
    boolean
    isOrderCalculated()
    Returns true if the order is calculated, otherwise false
    void
    restoreController(boolean orderCalculated, Player[] lastOrder, Player activePlayer, RoundPhase lastPhase, boolean isFirstRound)
    Restore the turn controller state after a game was restored.

  • Constructor Details

    • TurnController

      public TurnController(Player[] players, Game game)
      Construct a TurnController that will save the order of play of the specified players. The specified game is used to construct PhaseOrder instances
      Parameters:
      players - the players of the game (in clockwise order)
      game - the game of the players

  • Method Details

    • calculateOrder

      private void calculateOrder()
      Calculate the order of play in the new RoundPhase using the correct PhaseOrder way of calculating it

    • changePhase

      public void changePhase()
      Switch the current RoundPhase: if the previous one was 'planning phase' the new one is 'action phase' and vice-versa

    • endTurn

      public boolean endTurn()
      Do all operations that need to be done at the end of a player turn (changing the active player and eventually change the current RoundPhase)
      Returns:
      true if the current phase is finished, otherwise false

    • getActivePlayer

      public Player getActivePlayer()
      Return the current active player of the RoundPhase
      Returns:
      the active player

    • getCurrentPhase

      public RoundPhase getCurrentPhase()
      Return the current RoundPhase of the round
      Returns:

      public boolean isOrderCalculated()
      Returns true if the order is calculated, otherwise false
      Returns:
      true if the order is calculated, otherwise false

      Returns:
      the object that is responsible for calculating the order in planning phase

    • restoreController

      public void restoreController(boolean orderCalculated, Player[] lastOrder, Player activePlayer, RoundPhase lastPhase, boolean isFirstRound)
      Restore the turn controller state after a game was restored.
      Parameters:
      orderCalculated - boolean value that tells if order is calculated or not
      lastOrder - previous order before the interruption og the game
      activePlayer - is the active player in the turn
      lastPhase - last phase before the game interruption
      isFirstRound - boolean value that tells if is the first round
